summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. DiIorio to various judges, SEC officials, and others, alleging massive, ongoing securities fraud, money laundering, and criminal obstruction by the SEC and related entities. It focuses on market manipulation by Virtu Financial (NITE), penny stock fraud involving Barry Honig and associates, and the fraudulent nature of Riot Blockchain, while accusing SEC officials of protecting these criminal enterprises.

persons.name: Christopher J. DiIorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making detailed allegations of securities fraud, money laundering, and SEC corruption related to Knight Capital, Virtu Financial, Riot Blockchain, and various penny stock schemes.

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: Accused of knowingly lying about Virtu Financial's (NITE) equity market making share volumes to conceal illegal naked shorting and money laundering activities.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Referred to as a 'prolific Bag Man' involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells including Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix, Venaxis, Aspenbio), MGT Capital, and Inergetics.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Named in an SEC action for microcap stock fraud; alleged to be involved with Honig in money laundering shells like NewLead, FreeSeas, and Inergetics.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for acquiring and selling billions of penny stock shares without registering as a dealer; alleged to be involved with the MGT Capital shell.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for operating as an unregistered penny stock dealer under JMJ Financial.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: SEC official accused of conducting a grossly inadequate investigation into Riot Blockchain, failing to visit its alleged headquarters, and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Ms. Pasquinelli
persons.context: SEC official addressed in the correspondence regarding the SEC's failure to post eligible whistleblower award actions.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Referred to as a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' for alleged obstruction related to the Mark B. Fisher/MBF Clearing case.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.context: Former DOJ prosecutor on the Brian Colleran healthcare fraud case; appointed as a federal judge by Trump. Implied to have connections to the Colleran/Honig/Millenium Biotech scheme.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Healthcare executive who paid $19.5 million to resolve False Claims Act allegations; alleged to have been a large shareholder in the Honig-controlled shell Millenium Biotech/Inergetics.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: Russian executive and insider of Bioptix (precursor to Riot Blockchain), raising national security concerns about Russian involvement in the alleged money laundering shell.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.role: Owner of MBF Clearing and MBF Capital
persons.context: His firms were involved in a fraudulent acquisition by Riot Blockchain, with questions raised about a 'Miami' connection and SEC Director Eric Bustilloe.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Head of Aegis Capital, a firm accused of being a prolific money launderer for OTCM/NASDAQ shells, and involved in offerings for entities like Therapix/SciSparc.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager, NITE Board Member
persons.context: Described as a 'Not So Independent Board Member' of Virtu (NITE) with his own alleged money laundering shell, FSD Pharma.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Addressed in the correspondence regarding the fraudulent nature of Riot Blockchain and SEC corruption.

persons.name: Judge Cote
persons.context: Accused of a 'gross miscarriage of justice' in sentencing Dan Kamensky, allegedly due to a corrupt relationship between the SEC and Jefferies/Handler.

persons.name: Alex Kramm
persons.context: Analyst who questioned Dougie Cifu on Virtu's earnings call; cited by DiIorio as someone who should recognize Cifu's statements as lies.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Individual whose sentencing by Judge Cote is called a miscarriage of justice, allegedly set up by Handler/Ressler (Jefferies/Ares) for interfering with a deal.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of Northern Data's acquisition and sale of the Whinstone data center, which is linked to Riot Blockchain.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.context: Former private banker who founded Northern Data in 2015.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.role: CFO of Alleged Money Laundering Shells
persons.context: San Diego resident and CFO of several alleged OTCM money laundering shells like Viper Networks, linked to SEC LA office inaction.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group, another alleged money laundering shell with African/Egyptian ties.

connections.description: Alleged partners in multiple money laundering shell companies like NewLead, FreeSeas, and Inergetics/Millenium Biotech.
DiIorio alleges the SEC protects criminal enterprises like Honig's shells and Virtu (NITE), implying a systemic relationship where both benefit from SEC inaction.
DiIorio directly accuses Gottschall of SEC corruption and a fraudulent investigation into Riot Blockchain, mocking his inability to find Castle Rock on a map.
Colleran was a large shareholder in the Honig-controlled shell company Millenium Biotech/Inergetics after entering a fraudulent purchase agreement with it.
Robert Eide is the CEO of Aegis Capital Corp., a firm accused of being a prolific money launderer for penny stock shells.
Akhanov was an insider in Bioptix, the precursor company to Riot Blockchain, linking the alleged shell to Russian state interests (Rusnano).
Riot Blockchain fraudulently acquired a trading platform from Mark B. Fisher's MBF entities, facilitated by law firm Sichenzia Ross.
David Urban is described as a 'Not So Independent Board Member' of Virtu Financial (NITE).

events.title: Virtu Financial Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: Virtu CEO Dougie Cifu states April equity market making volumes were 'a hair under 10 billion shares per day,' which the whistleblower alleges is a blatant lie to conceal massive illegal naked shorting and OTCM money laundering volumes.

events.title: SEC Ends Riot Blockchain Investigation
events.description: SEC official Mr. Gottschall terminates the investigation into Riot Blockchain without recommending enforcement action. The whistleblower claims the investigation was fraudulent and that Gottschall never visited Riot's alleged headquarters.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: The SEC files charges against Joshua Sason and others for an elaborate microcap stock fraud. The whistleblower claims this action was based on his information but was not posted as award-eligible.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife
events.description: The SEC charges John M. Fife and companies he controls for acting as an unregistered securities dealer, selling over 21 billion shares of penny stock.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin W. Keener
events.description: The SEC charges Justin W. Keener (d/b/a JMJ Financial) for acting as an unregistered penny stock dealer.

events.title: Riot Blockchain Offering with Susquehanna/CVI
events.description: Following the SEC's termination of its investigation, Riot Blockchain conducts an offering that results in a Susquehanna/CVI 'pump and dump,' per the whistleblower.

events.title: Millenium Biotech $20M Fraud Agreement
events.description: Healthcare fraud felon Brian Colleran enters into a $20 million purchase agreement with Millenium Biotech, later becoming a large shareholder in the Honig-controlled shell.

locations: 20 Raul Wallenberg Street Tower A, Tel Aviv, Israel
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. DiIorio, alleges the SEC is actively facilitating and covering up massive, ongoing securities fraud and money laundering involving Virtu Financial (NITE), Riot Blockchain, and numerous penny stock shells.

Riot Blockchain is alleged to be a front and money laundering shell controlled by Barry Honig and associates, with ties to Russian interests (Dmitry Akhanov/Rusnano) and no real office at its SEC filing address in Castle Rock, CO.

SEC officials, including Mr. Gottschall and Eric Bustilloe, are accused of gross criminal obstruction and corruption by conducting sham investigations and protecting criminal enterprises like NITE and Honig's shells.

Virtu Financial CEO Dougie Cifu is accused of knowingly lying about the company's equity market making share volumes to conceal that its core business is illegal naked shorting of OTCM shells to facilitate money laundering.

Multiple SEC enforcement actions (Sason, Fife, Keener) that the whistleblower claims were based on his information have not been posted to the SEC's whistleblower award-eligible website, which he cites as evidence of obstruction.
